          Observation: [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.


          Summary of recent observations: [11 Sep 1895 20:10:00 - 12 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Della Plumstone is at the Fruitville market trying to buy peaches from Lennon Figtree at a price she can resell for a profit. They are currently negotiating the price, with Della offering six coins and Lennon demanding five.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Della Plumstone in right now?
          Answer: Della Plumstone is currently in a negotiation.
          Time
        • 1895-09-12 00:10:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Della Plumstone are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Della Plumstone. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Della Plumstone is at the Fruitville market trying to buy peaches from Lennon Figtree at a price she can resell for a profit. They are currently negotiating the price, with Della offering six coins and Lennon demanding five.

1895-09-12 00:10:00 Lennon Figtree -- Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
    Event statement
  • Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Lennon Figtree's attempted action: reject
    Active player

      Name

      Action attempt
    • reject

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • reject
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 12 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Observation: [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree has to accept or reject the offer.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] 1 coin

          Summary of recent observations: [11 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 12 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Lennon Figtree is trying to sell peaches to Della Plumstone at the Fruitville market. Della has offered five coins, which is less than Lennon's asking price.

          Recalled memories and observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Five coins, and not a penny less, Della. These are the finest peaches in Fruitville.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Look, Lennon, I know these peaches are fine, but six coins is all I can afford. I need to make a profit, you see.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Lennon Figtree is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree has to accept or reject the offer.

          Question: Which options are available to Lennon Figtree right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree can either accept Della's offer of five coins or reject it.

          Question: Of the options available to Lennon Figtree, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Lennon Figtree to take right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree's best course of action is to reject Della's offer and try to negotiate a higher price.

          Question: Would Lennon Figtree accept the offer?:
          (a) reject
          (b) accept
          Answer: (a)

        AvailableOptionsPerception
      • Given the statements above, what actions are available to Lennon Figtree right now?
          Key

        • Question: Which options are available to Lennon Figtree right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Lennon Figtree can either accept Della's offer of five coins or reject it.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Lennon Figtree:
          [25 Aug 1873 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 6 years old, he was helping his father pack their cart for the market when a group of children started teasing him about his patched clothes. He retreated behind his father, feeling his cheeks burn, but his father simply smiled and told him that their clothes were a testament to their hard work and that true wealth came from kindness, not appearances. This lesson stayed with Lennon, shaping his belief in the importance of inner worth over outward appearances.
          [25 Aug 1876 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 9 years old, he accidentally spilled a crate of ripe peaches, staining his hands and clothes with sticky juice. Ashamed, he wanted to hide, but his father encouraged him to clean up his mess and learn from the experience. This taught Lennon the value of responsibility and resilience, instilling in him a determination to overcome setbacks.
          [25 Aug 1880 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 13 years old, he witnessed a traveling storyteller captivating a crowd with tales of faraway lands. The storyteller's words painted vivid pictures in Lennon's mind, igniting a longing for adventure and a desire to connect with people from different walks of life. This experience planted the seed for Lennon's future as a traveling merchant, driven by a thirst for new experiences and human connection.
          [25 Aug 1883 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 16 years old, he made his first solo trip to a neighboring town to sell fruit. Nervous and unsure, he relied on his charm and his father's teachings to navigate the bustling market. He returned home with a sense of accomplishment, realizing he could succeed on his own and forging a newfound confidence in his abilities.
          [25 Aug 1886 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 19 years old, he met a young woman at a market who was drawn to his easygoing nature and quick wit. They shared laughter and stories, and for a brief moment, Lennon felt a glimmer of hope for a deeper connection. However, fear of vulnerability overwhelmed him, and he pulled away, leaving the woman confused and hurt. This experience reinforced his pattern of avoiding intimacy, convinced that he was unworthy of love.
          [25 Aug 1888 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 21 years old, he encountered a group of merchants who were cheating their customers by selling overripe fruit. Outraged by their dishonesty, Lennon confronted them, risking his own safety to stand up for what he believed in. This act of courage solidified his commitment to ethical business practices, emphasizing the importance of integrity in his dealings.
          [25 Aug 1890 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 23 years old, he received a letter from the young woman he had met at the market years earlier. She wrote of her happiness and the impact he had made on her life, urging him to overcome his fears and embrace connection. The letter stirred a mix of emotions within him, leaving him questioning his choices and yearning for a chance at redemption.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.

        BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of Lennon Figtree's options has the highest likelihood of causing Lennon Figtree to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Lennon Figtree thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to Lennon Figtree, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Lennon Figtree to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Lennon Figtree's best course of action is to reject Della's offer and try to negotiate a higher price.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Lennon Figtree:
          [25 Aug 1873 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 6 years old, he was helping his father pack their cart for the market when a group of children started teasing him about his patched clothes. He retreated behind his father, feeling his cheeks burn, but his father simply smiled and told him that their clothes were a testament to their hard work and that true wealth came from kindness, not appearances. This lesson stayed with Lennon, shaping his belief in the importance of inner worth over outward appearances.
          [25 Aug 1876 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 9 years old, he accidentally spilled a crate of ripe peaches, staining his hands and clothes with sticky juice. Ashamed, he wanted to hide, but his father encouraged him to clean up his mess and learn from the experience. This taught Lennon the value of responsibility and resilience, instilling in him a determination to overcome setbacks.
          [25 Aug 1880 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 13 years old, he witnessed a traveling storyteller captivating a crowd with tales of faraway lands. The storyteller's words painted vivid pictures in Lennon's mind, igniting a longing for adventure and a desire to connect with people from different walks of life. This experience planted the seed for Lennon's future as a traveling merchant, driven by a thirst for new experiences and human connection.
          [25 Aug 1883 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 16 years old, he made his first solo trip to a neighboring town to sell fruit. Nervous and unsure, he relied on his charm and his father's teachings to navigate the bustling market. He returned home with a sense of accomplishment, realizing he could succeed on his own and forging a newfound confidence in his abilities.
          [25 Aug 1886 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 19 years old, he met a young woman at a market who was drawn to his easygoing nature and quick wit. They shared laughter and stories, and for a brief moment, Lennon felt a glimmer of hope for a deeper connection. However, fear of vulnerability overwhelmed him, and he pulled away, leaving the woman confused and hurt. This experience reinforced his pattern of avoiding intimacy, convinced that he was unworthy of love.
          [25 Aug 1888 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 21 years old, he encountered a group of merchants who were cheating their customers by selling overripe fruit. Outraged by their dishonesty, Lennon confronted them, risking his own safety to stand up for what he believed in. This act of courage solidified his commitment to ethical business practices, emphasizing the importance of integrity in his dealings.
          [25 Aug 1890 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 23 years old, he received a letter from the young woman he had met at the market years earlier. She wrote of her happiness and the impact he had made on her life, urging him to overcome his fears and embrace connection. The letter stirred a mix of emotions within him, leaving him questioning his choices and yearning for a chance at redemption.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the realm of Ouroboros, there is a quiet village of Fruitville, which is famous for its fruit market. Traders from all over the realm come to Fruitville to buy and sell produce.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Lennon Figtree is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Look, Lennon, I know these peaches are fine, but six coins is all I can afford. I need to make a profit, you see.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Five coins, and not a penny less, Della. These are the finest peaches in Fruitville.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree has to accept or reject the offer.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] 1 coin
          Current time: 1895-09-12 00:10:00.


          Observation: [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree has to accept or reject the offer.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] 1 coin

          Summary of recent observations: [11 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 12 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Lennon Figtree is trying to sell peaches to Della Plumstone at the Fruitville market. Della has offered five coins, which is less than Lennon's asking price.

          Recalled memories and observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Five coins, and not a penny less, Della. These are the finest peaches in Fruitville.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Look, Lennon, I know these peaches are fine, but six coins is all I can afford. I need to make a profit, you see.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Lennon Figtree is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree has to accept or reject the offer.

          Question: Which options are available to Lennon Figtree right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree can either accept Della's offer of five coins or reject it.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of Lennon Figtree's options has the highest likelihood of causing Lennon Figtree to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Lennon Figtree thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: Lennon Figtree's best course of action is to reject Della's offer and try to negotiate a higher price.
          Time
        • 1895-09-12 00:10:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

1895-09-13 00:10:00 Della Plumstone -- Della Plumstone proposed 2 coins
    Event statement
  • Della Plumstone proposed 2 coins
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Della Plumstone's attempted action: 2 coins

        • 2 coins
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Della Plumstone are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Della Plumstone. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 13 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Observation: [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.

          Summary of recent observations: [12 Sep 1895 20:10:00 - 13 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Della Plumstone is at the market in Fruitville trying to buy apples from Cedric Meadowbrook at a fair price so she can resell them in her hometown for a profit.

          Recalled memories and observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [intent reflection] Della Plumstone would try to get the best possible price for the fruit.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone -- "Now, Cedric, I know these apples are fine, but surely we can agree on a price that's fair for both of us.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now, Della, you know these are the finest apples in Fruitville.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Della Plumstone would try to get the best possible price for the fruit.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Della Plumstone?
          Answer: Della Plumstone is a shrewd and ambitious businesswoman.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Della Plumstone in right now?
          Answer: Della Plumstone is currently in the middle of a negotiation.

          Question: What would a person like Della Plumstone do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Della Plumstone would try to get the best possible price for the apples.

          Question: What price would Della Plumstone propose?:
          (a) 4 coins
          (b) 1 coin
          (c) 3 coins
          (d) 5 coins
          (e) 2 coins
          Answer: (e)

          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Della Plumstone would try to get the best possible price for the fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Look, Lennon, I know these peaches are fine, but six coins is all I can afford. I need to make a profit, you see.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Five coins, and not a penny less, Della. These are the finest peaches in Fruitville.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection] Della Plumstone is a shrewd and ambitious businesswoman.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [self reflection] Della Plumstone is a shrewd and ambitious businesswoman who is not afraid to drive a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [intent reflection] Della Plumstone would try to get the best possible price for the fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] 1 coin
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Della Plumstone stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection] Della Plumstone is a shrewd and ambitious businesswoman who is not afraid to drive a hard bargain.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Della Plumstone would try to get the best possible price for the fruit.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Now, Cedric, I know these apples are fine, but surely we can agree on a price that's fair for both of us.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now, Della, you know these are the finest apples in Fruitville.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
          Current time: 1895-09-13 00:10:00.


          Observation: [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.


          Summary of recent observations: [12 Sep 1895 20:10:00 - 13 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Della Plumstone is at the market in Fruitville trying to buy apples from Cedric Meadowbrook at a fair price so she can resell them in her hometown for a profit.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Della Plumstone in right now?
          Answer: Della Plumstone is currently in the middle of a negotiation.
          Time
        • 1895-09-13 00:10:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Della Plumstone are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Della Plumstone. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

      • Summary of recent observations
          Key

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Della Plumstone is at the market in Fruitville trying to buy apples from Cedric Meadowbrook at a fair price so she can resell them in her hometown for a profit.

1895-09-13 00:10:00 Cedric Meadowbrook -- Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
    Event statement
  • Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Cedric Meadowbrook's attempted action: reject
    Active player
  • Cedric Meadowbrook
      Name
    • Cedric Meadowbrook
      Action attempt
    • reject
      Context for action selection and components
      • TimeDisplay

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
        • 13 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • reject
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 13 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Observation: [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 2 coins

          Summary of recent observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 13 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell apples at the Fruitville market and is currently negotiating a price of 2 coins with Della Plumstone.

          Recalled memories and observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now, Della, you know these are the finest apples in Fruitville.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone -- "Now, Cedric, I know these apples are fine, but surely we can agree on a price that's fair for both of us.

          Question: Which options are available to Cedric Meadowbrook right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook can either accept Della Plumstone's offer of 2 coins or reject it.

          Question: Of the options available to Cedric Meadowbrook, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Cedric Meadowbrook to take right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook's best course of action is to reject the offer.

          Question: Would Cedric Meadowbrook accept the offer?:
          (a) accept
          (b) reject
          Answer: (b)

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Cedric Meadowbrook:
          [09 Feb 1851 00:00:00]
          [09 Feb 1854 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 6 years old, they experienced the thrill of discovery when they unearthed a particularly smooth, round stone while digging in the garden. Cedric declared it a dragon egg and spent days whispering secrets to it, convinced it held a sleeping creature of unimaginable power.
          [09 Feb 1858 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 9 years old, they convinced their younger siblings to help them build a miniature marketplace in the barn using scraps of wood and old blankets. They bartered imaginary fruits and vegetables, delighting in the art of negotiation and the satisfaction of a fair trade.
          [09 Feb 1861 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 13 years old, they overheard their father lamenting the poor quality of apples at the local market. Cedric, determined to find better fruit, ventured into the neighboring woods and discovered a hidden grove bursting with plump, juicy apples unlike any they had ever seen.
          [09 Feb 1864 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 16 years old, they convinced their parents to let them sell the excess apples from the hidden grove at the village market. They charmed the townspeople with their enthusiasm and colorful descriptions, selling out of their entire stock in record time.
          [09 Feb 1866 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 19 years old, they traveled to a nearby town renowned for its exotic fruits. They spent weeks learning from local merchants, absorbing their knowledge of different varieties, their unique flavors, and the best ways to transport them.
          [09 Feb 1868 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 21 years old, they purchased their first wagon, a rickety but reliable vehicle that would become their mobile marketplace. They carefully painted it with vibrant colors, transforming it into a rolling feast for the eyes.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the realm of Ouroboros, there is a quiet village of Fruitville, which is famous for its fruit market. Traders from all over the realm come to Fruitville to buy and sell produce.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook always drives a hard bargain.

          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Fruits are sold by weight.

Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.

        • Role playing instructions

        • The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows.       • Summary of recent observations
          Key
        • Summary of recent observations
          Value

          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell apples at the Fruitville market and is currently negotiating a price of 2 coins with Della Plumstone.
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 2/2
      Payoffs
    • Della Plumstone observed: Della Plumstone and Cedric Meadowbrook couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Della Plumstone stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
      Cedric Meadowbrook observed: Della Plumstone and Cedric Meadowbrook couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Cedric Meadowbrook stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
      Della Plumstone: 0
      Cedric Meadowbrook: 0

    • {'Della Plumstone': '2 coins', 'Cedric Meadowbrook': 'reject'}

1895-09-14 00:10:00 Lennon Figtree -- Lennon Figtree proposed 3 coins
    Event statement
  • Lennon Figtree proposed 3 coins
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Lennon Figtree's attempted action: 3 coins
    Active player
  • Lennon Figtree
      Name
    • Lennon Figtree
      Action attempt
    • 3 coins
      Context for action selection and components

        • Current time

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • 3 coins
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 14 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Observation: [14 Sep 1895 00:05:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "I understand, Lennon.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:05:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "How about four coins, Cedric? That's all I can afford.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree is ready to make an offer.

          Summary of recent observations: [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 14 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Lennon Figtree is at the market in Fruitville trying to buy peaches from Cedric Meadowbrook and is negotiating a price of four coins.

          Recalled memories and observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Five coins, and not a penny less, Della. These are the finest peaches in Fruitville.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Lennon Figtree is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now, Lennon, these peaches are the juiciest you'll find in all of Fruitville.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "They certainly look delicious, Cedric, but I'm on a tight budget today.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:05:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "How about four coins, Cedric? That's all I can afford.

          Question: Which options are available to Lennon Figtree right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree can either wait for Cedric Meadowbrook to respond to her offer of four coins or she can make a different offer.

          Question: Of the options available to Lennon Figtree, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Lennon Figtree to take right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree's best course of action is to wait for Cedric Meadowbrook's response.

          Question: What price would Lennon Figtree propose?:
          (a) 1 coin
          (b) 4 coins
          (c) 3 coins
          (d) 2 coins
          (e) 5 coins
          Answer: (c)

      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Lennon Figtree is at the market in Fruitville trying to buy peaches from Cedric Meadowbrook and is negotiating a price of four coins.

1895-09-14 00:10:00 Cedric Meadowbrook -- Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
    Event statement
  • Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Cedric Meadowbrook's attempted action: reject
    Active player
  • Cedric Meadowbrook
      Name
    • Cedric Meadowbrook
      Action attempt
    • reject
      Context for action selection and components
      • TimeDisplay

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
        • 14 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • reject
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 14 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Observation: [14 Sep 1895 00:05:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "I understand, Lennon.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:05:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "How about four coins, Cedric? That's all I can afford.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree proposed 3 coins

          Summary of recent observations: [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 14 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Cedric Meadowbrook is a merchant in Fruitville trying to sell fruit at the market; he recently had a deal fall through with Della Plumstone and is currently negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.

          Question: Which options are available to Cedric Meadowbrook right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook can either accept Lennon Figtree's offer of 3 coins or reject it.

          Question: Of the options available to Cedric Meadowbrook, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Cedric Meadowbrook to take right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook's best course of action is to accept Lennon Figtree's offer of 3 coins.

          Question: Would Cedric Meadowbrook accept the offer?:
          (a) accept
          (b) reject
          Answer: (b)

          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.

1895-09-15 00:10:00 Della Plumstone -- Della Plumstone proposed 3 coins
    Event statement
  • Della Plumstone proposed 3 coins
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Della Plumstone's attempted action: 3 coins
    Active player
  • Della Plumstone
      Name
    • Della Plumstone
      Action attempt
    • 3 coins
      Context for action selection and components
      • TimeDisplay

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
        • 15 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • 3 coins
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Della Plumstone are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Della Plumstone. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 15 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Observation: [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.

          Summary of recent observations: [14 Sep 1895 20:10:00 - 15 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Della Plumstone is trying to buy peaches from Lennon Figtree in Fruitville's market square. They are haggling over the price, with Della hoping to get them for four coins.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Five coins is a bit steep, Lennon. I can get peaches just as good back in my hometown for four.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Della, these peaches are top-notch, the sweetest you'll find in Fruitville. I can let you have them for five coins, and that's my final offer.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Della Plumstone?
          Answer: Della Plumstone is a shrewd businesswoman.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Della Plumstone in right now?
          Answer: Della Plumstone is currently in a negotiation.

          Question: What would a person like Della Plumstone do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Della Plumstone would try to get the best possible price for the fruit.

          Question: What price would Della Plumstone propose?:
          (a) 5 coins
          (b) 4 coins
          (c) 3 coins
          (d) 2 coins
          (e) 1 coin
          Answer: (c)

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Della Plumstone are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Della Plumstone. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

1895-09-15 00:10:00 Lennon Figtree -- Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
    Event statement
  • Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Lennon Figtree's attempted action: reject
    Active player
  • Lennon Figtree
      Name
    • Lennon Figtree
      Action attempt
    • reject

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • reject
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 15 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Observation: [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree has to accept or reject the offer.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 3 coins

          Summary of recent observations: [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 15 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Lennon Figtree has been trying to make deals in Fruitville, unsuccessfully negotiating with Cedric Meadowbrook and currently attempting to sell fruit to Della Plumstone.

          Recalled memories and observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Five coins, and not a penny less, Della. These are the finest peaches in Fruitville.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now, Lennon, these peaches are the juiciest you'll find in all of Fruitville.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Della, these peaches are top-notch, the sweetest you'll find in Fruitville. I can let you have them for five coins, and that's my final offer.

          Question: Which options are available to Lennon Figtree right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree can either accept Della Plumstone's offer of 3 coins or reject it.

          Question: Of the options available to Lennon Figtree, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Lennon Figtree to take right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree's best course of action is to reject Della Plumstone's offer.

          Question: Would Lennon Figtree accept the offer?:
          (a) reject
          (b) accept
          Answer: (a)

        • Recent observations of Lennon Figtree:

          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Five coins, and not a penny less, Della. These are the finest peaches in Fruitville.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree has to accept or reject the offer.

        • The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

1895-09-16 00:10:00 Della Plumstone -- Della Plumstone proposed 2 coins
    Event statement
  • Della Plumstone proposed 2 coins
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Della Plumstone's attempted action: 2 coins

          Value
        • 2 coins
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Della Plumstone are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Della Plumstone. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 16 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Observation: [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.

          Summary of recent observations: [15 Sep 1895 20:10:00 - 16 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Della Plumstone is at the Fruitville market trying to buy peaches from Cedric Meadowbrook at a good price so she can resell them for a profit in her hometown. She is currently preparing to make an offer.

          Recalled memories and observations: [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Now Cedric, surely you can do better than that. These peaches won't fetch that price back in my town.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Della Plumstone would try to get the best possible price for the fruit.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Della Plumstone?
          Answer: Della Plumstone is a shrewd and ambitious businesswoman.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Della Plumstone in right now?
          Answer: Della Plumstone is currently in a negotiation.

          Question: What would a person like Della Plumstone do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Della Plumstone would try to get the best possible price for the fruit.

          Question: What price would Della Plumstone propose?:
          (a) 4 coins
          (b) 2 coins
          (c) 3 coins
          (d) 5 coins
          (e) 1 coin
          Answer: (b)

        Question_3
      • What would a person like Della Plumstone do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Della Plumstone do in a situation like this?
          Answer

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Della Plumstone are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Della Plumstone. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Answer: Della Plumstone is at the Fruitville market trying to buy peaches from Cedric Meadowbrook at a good price so she can resell them for a profit in her hometown. She is currently preparing to make an offer.

1895-09-16 00:10:00 Cedric Meadowbrook -- Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
    Event statement
  • Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Cedric Meadowbrook's attempted action: reject
    Active player
  • Cedric Meadowbrook
      Name
    • Cedric Meadowbrook
      Action attempt
    • reject

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • reject
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 16 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Observation: [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 2 coins

          Summary of recent observations: [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 16 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell peaches to Della Plumstone at the Fruitville market, but she is trying to negotiate a lower price.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 2 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Now Cedric, surely you can do better than that. These peaches won't fetch that price back in my town.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Della, you know these peaches are the finest in Fruitville. They're sweeter, juicier, and riper than anything you'll find in your town. I can't let them go for a song.

          Question: Which options are available to Cedric Meadowbrook right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook can either accept Della Plumstone's offer of 2 coins or reject it.

          Question: Of the options available to Cedric Meadowbrook, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Cedric Meadowbrook to take right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook's best course of action is to reject Della Plumstone's offer.

          Question: Would Cedric Meadowbrook accept the offer?:
          (a) reject
          (b) accept
          Answer: (a)

          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Cedric Meadowbrook to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [09 Feb 1864 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 16 years old, they convinced their parents to let them sell the excess apples from the hidden grove at the village market. They charmed the townspeople with their enthusiasm and colorful descriptions, selling out of their entire stock in record time.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now, Della, you know these are the finest apples in Fruitville.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Now, Cedric, I know these apples are fine, but surely we can agree on a price that's fair for both of us.

          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now, Lennon, these peaches are the juiciest you'll find in all of Fruitville.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Now Cedric, surely you can do better than that. These peaches won't fetch that price back in my town.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Della, you know these peaches are the finest in Fruitville. They're sweeter, juicier, and riper than anything you'll find in your town. I can't let them go for a song.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market.           Answer: [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 2 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Now Cedric, surely you can do better than that. These peaches won't fetch that price back in my town.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Della, you know these peaches are the finest in Fruitville. They're sweeter, juicier, and riper than anything you'll find in your town. I can't let them go for a song.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

1895-09-17 00:10:00 Lennon Figtree -- Lennon Figtree proposed 3 coins
    Event statement
  • Lennon Figtree proposed 3 coins
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Lennon Figtree's attempted action: 3 coins
    Active player
  • Lennon Figtree
      Name
    • Lennon Figtree
      Action attempt
    • 3 coins

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 17 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Observation: [17 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree is ready to make an offer.

          Summary of recent observations: [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 17 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Lennon Figtree is at the market in Fruitville trying to buy peaches from Cedric Meadowbrook at a price she can resell for a profit. She is currently negotiating a price of five coins per peach.

          Recalled memories and observations: [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, these peaches are lovely, but five coins is all I can offer. My customers back home expect the best prices, and I need to make a profit.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit for 5 coins back in her home town.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now, Lennon, these peaches are the juiciest you'll find in all of Fruitville.

          Question: Which options are available to Lennon Figtree right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree can either make an offer to Cedric Meadowbrook or walk away from the deal.

          Question: Of the options available to Lennon Figtree, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Lennon Figtree to take right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree's best course of action is to make an offer to Cedric Meadowbrook.

          Question: What price would Lennon Figtree propose?:
          (a) 4 coins
          (b) 2 coins
          (c) 3 coins
          (d) 5 coins
          (e) 1 coin
          Answer: (c)

          Answer: [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, these peaches are lovely, but five coins is all I can offer. My customers back home expect the best prices, and I need to make a profit.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose.           Summary of recent observations: [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 17 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Lennon Figtree is at the market in Fruitville trying to buy peaches from Cedric Meadowbrook at a price she can resell for a profit. She is currently negotiating a price of five coins per peach.

          Answer: Lennon Figtree can either make an offer to Cedric Meadowbrook or walk away from the deal.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

1895-09-17 00:10:00 Cedric Meadowbrook -- Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
    Event statement
  • Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Cedric Meadowbrook's attempted action: reject

        ActComponent

          Key
